    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        Returns the tenant's globally-unique name in Stormpath.

        THIS CAN CHANGE IN THE FUTURE. Do not rely on it as a permanent identifier. If you need a permanent ID, use the href as the permanent ID (this is true for all resources, not just Tenant resources).

        Returns:
        the tenant's Stormpath globally-unique name. THIS CAN CHANGE. Do not rely on it as a permanent identifier.

      • getKey

        String getKey()
        Returns the tenant's globally-unique human-readable key in Stormpath.

        THIS CAN CHANGE IN THE FUTURE. Do not rely on it as a permanent identifier. If you need a permanent ID, use the href as the permanent ID (this is true for all resources, not just Tenant resources).

        Returns:
        the tenant's Stormpath globally-unique human-readable name key. THIS CAN CHANGE. Do not rely on it as a permanent identifier.

      • createApplication

        Application createApplication(Application application)
                              throws ResourceException
        Creates a new Application resource in the Tenant.
        Parameters:
        application - the Application resource to create.
        Returns:
        the created Application
        Throws:
        ResourceException - if there was a problem creating the application.
        See Also:
        createApplication(com.stormpath.sdk.application.CreateApplicationRequest)

      • createApplication

        Application createApplication(CreateApplicationRequest request)
                              throws ResourceException
        Creates a new Application resource in the Tenant based on the specified CreateCreateApplicationRequest.

        Usage

         tenant.createApplication(Applications.newCreateRequestFor(application).build());

        If you would like to automatically create a Directory for this application's own needs: 

         tenant.createApplication(Applications.newCreateRequestFor(application).createDirectory().build());
        The directory's name will be auto-generated to reflect your Application as closely as possible and not conflict with any existing Directories in your tenant.

        Or if you prefer to specify the directory name yourself: 

         tenant.createApplication(Applications.newCreateRequestFor(application).createDirectoryNamed("My Directory").build());
        But note - if the specified directory name is already in use, a Resource Exception will be thrown to let you know you must choose another Directory name.
        Parameters:
        request - the request reflecting how to create the Application
        Returns:
        the application created.
        Throws:
        ResourceException - if there was a problem creating the application.
        Since:
        0.8

      • getApplications

        ApplicationList getApplications()
        Returns a paginated list of all of the Tenant's Application resources.

        Tip: Instead of iterating over all applications, it might be more convenient (and practical) to execute a search for one or more directories using the getApplications(java.util.Map) method instead of this one.

        Returns:
        a paginated list of all of the Tenant's Application resources.
        See Also:
        getApplications(java.util.Map)

      • getApplications

        ApplicationList getApplications(Map<String,Object> queryParams)
        Returns a paginated list of the Tenant's applications that match the specified query criteria.

        Each queryParams key/value pair will be converted to String name to String value pairs and appended to the resource URL as query parameters, for example: 

         .../tenants/tenantId/applications?param1=value1¶m2=value2&...
        Parameters:
        queryParams - the query parameters to use when performing a request to the collection.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of the Tenant's applications that match the specified query criteria.
        Since:
        0.8

      • getApplications

        ApplicationList getApplications(ApplicationCriteria criteria)
        Returns a paginated list of the Tenant's applications that match the specified query criteria. The Applications utility class is available to help construct the criteria DSL. For example: 
         tenant.getApplications(Applications
     .where(Applications.description().containsIgnoreCase("foo"))
     .and(Applications.name().startsWithIgnoreCase("bar"))
     .orderByName().descending()
     .withAccounts(10, 10)
     .offsetBy(20)
     .limitTo(25));
        Parameters:
        criteria - the the query parameters to use when performing a request to the collection.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of the Tenant's applications that match the specified query criteria.
        Since:
        0.8

      • createDirectory

        Directory createDirectory(Directory directory)
        Creates a new Cloud Directory resource in the Tenant.

        Mirrored (LDAP or Active Directory) Directories cannot be created via the REST API or SDKs.

        This method creates a natively hosted directory in Stormpath. Please use the Stormpath Admin UI if you need to create an LDAP/AD mirrored directory.

        Parameters:
        directory - the Directory resource to create.
        Returns:
        the directory created.
        Throws:
        ResourceException - if there was a problem creating the directory.
        Since:
        0.9.0

      • getDirectories

        DirectoryList getDirectories()
        Returns a paginated list of all of the Tenant's Directory instances.

        Tip: Instead of iterating over all directories, it might be more convenient (and practical) to execute a search for one or more directories using the getDirectories(java.util.Map) method instead of this one.

        Returns:
        a paginated list of all of the Tenant's Directory instances.
        See Also:
        getDirectories(java.util.Map)

      • getDirectories

        DirectoryList getDirectories(Map<String,Object> queryParams)
        Returns a paginated list of the Tenant's directories that match the specified query criteria.

        Each queryParams key/value pair will be converted to String name to String value pairs and appended to the resource URL as query parameters, for example: 

         .../tenants/tenantId/directories?param1=value1¶m2=value2&...
        Parameters:
        queryParams - the query parameters to use when performing a request to the collection.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of the Tenant's directories that match the specified query criteria.
        Since:
        0.8

      • getDirectories

        DirectoryList getDirectories(DirectoryCriteria criteria)
        Returns a paginated list of the Tenant's directories that match the specified query criteria. The Directories utility class is available to help construct the criteria DSL. For example: 
         tenant.getDirectories(Directories
     .where(Directories.description().containsIgnoreText("foo"))
     .and(Directories.name().startsWithIgnoreCase("bar"))
     .orderByName().descending()
     .withAccounts(10, 10)
     .offsetBy(20)
     .limitTo(25));
        Parameters:
        criteria - the the query parameters to use when performing a request to the collection.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of the Tenant's applications that match the specified query criteria.
        Since:
        0.8

      • verifyAccountEmail

        Account verifyAccountEmail(String token)
        Verifies an account's email address based on a sptoken query parameter embedded in a clickable URL found in an account verification email. For example: 
         https://my.company.com/email/verify?sptoken=ExAmPleEmAilVeRiFiCaTiOnTokEnHeRE
        Based on this URL, the following should be invoked: 
         tenant.verifyAccountEmail("ExAmPleEmAilVeRiFiCaTiOnTokEnHeRE");

        If the token is valid, the associated account will be validated (changing the account's status from UNVERIFIED to ENABLED) and returned.

        Parameters:
        token - the clickable URL's sptoken query parameter value
        Since:
        0.4
